description:
Redevelopment of the site by the erection of a 4 storey
building to accommodate 14 live/work units with associated
landscaping,
as shown on drawing numbers 020102/01 and 02A-05A.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The applicants shall submit to the Council a noise and
    vibration survey of the site together with a scheme for the
    provision of sound and vibration attenuation measures for
    the proposed building, and no development shall be carried
    out until the survey and attenuation scheme have been
    approved by the Council, and thereafter the development
    shall be completed in strict accordance with the approved
    details.

Condition : 2 - At 1 metre outside the windows of any neighbouring habitable room the level of noise from all plant and machinery shall be at all times at least 5 decibels below the existing background noise levels, expressed in dB(A) at such locations. Where the noise from the plant and machinery is tonal in character the differences in these levels shall be at least 10 dB(A).

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the [adjoining] premises [and the area generally] in accordance with the requirements of policy[ies] RE2[, EN5, EN6 and DS6] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 3 - The two car parking spaces shown on drawing number 020102/
    02A hereby approved shall only be used for visitors and
    deliveries to the site, and the circulation/turning space
    shown on the same drawing shall be provided prior to the
    first occupation of the building and thereafter permanently
    retained throughout the period of the occupation of the
    building.

Condition : 4 - The proposed obscured glass screens at rear top floor level
    shown on drawing numbers 020102/03A and 04A shall be
    provided prior to the first occupation of the building, and
    permanently retained thereafter.

Condition : 5 - No development shall take place until full details of hard and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all un-built, open areas have been submitted to and approved by the Council. [Such details shall include details of any proposed earthworks including grading, mounding and other changes in ground levels.] 

Reason: To enable the Council to ensure a reasonable standard of visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the requirements of policies [EN15 if landscape details], [EN61 if trees only] [and EN35 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 6 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to by not later than the end of the following planting season, with others of similar size and species, unless the Council gives written consent to any variation. a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved landscape details by not later than the end of the planting season following completion of the development or any phase of the development, whichever is the sooner. Any trees or areas of planting which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably possible and, in any case,

Condition : 7 - The facing materials to be used on the ................. shall not be otherwise than as shall have been submitted to and approved by the Council before any work on the site is commenced.

Condition : 8 - A contaminated land survey and plan shall be submitted to
    and approved by the Council before any work in respect of
    the construction of the building hereby approved is
    commenced, and the development shall be completed in full
    accordance with the approved survey and plan. The survey
    shall include an assessment of the likelihood of the
    presence of contaminated land on the site, the results of
    soil analysis and measures for the disposal of contaminated
    land, if necessary.

Condition : 9 - Provision shall be made for facilities for the parking of at
    least 3 bicycles in a form and location to be agreed in
    writing by the Council, and the approved bicycle parking
    facilities shall be provided prior to the first occupation
    of the building and thereafter permanently retained.

Condition : 10 - The lift shall be provided in strict accordance with the
    details shown on the drawings hereby approved prior to the
    first occupation of the building, and it shall thereafter be
    permanently retained as such.

Condition : 11 - In order to ensure future occupiers have an acceptable level
    of amenity in view of the proximity of the adjoining railway
    line, and in order to meet the requirements of policies EN1,
    EN5 and DS6 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary
    Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 12 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in order to ensure compliance with the
    requirements of polices EN1, EN6, DS6, of the London Borough
    of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 13 - In order to ensure that visitors and deliveries do not
    lead to additional parking stress on the surrounding
    streets, and that vehicles that enter the site have
    sufficient space to turn and exit in a forward facing
    manner, in the interests of traffic safety. This is to
    ensure the proposal is in accordance with the requirements
    of policies TR16, TR17, and TR19 of the London Borough of
    Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 14 - In order to protect the visual privacy of existing
    residential occupiers of premises on Iverson Road, and in
    accordance with the requirements of policies EN1, EN19, and
    DS5 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan
    2000.

Condition : 15 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 16 - To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a
    reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of
    visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN15, EN52 of the London Borough of
    Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 17 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1, EN13, EN14 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 18 - To ensure that the development is carried out in accordance
    with the requirements of policy EN10 of the London Borough
    of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 19 - To ensure that adequate cycle parking facilities are
    provided in accordance with the requirements of policies
    TR12 and DS8 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary
    Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 20 - To ensure that the upper level of the live/work units are
    capable of beneficial use as 50% employment floorspace, in
    accordance with the intentions of the scheme and the
    requirements of policies EC3 and EC5 of the London Borough
    of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 21 - Works of construction and ancillary activity should not take
    place other than between the hours of 08.00am to 18.00 pm on
    Monday to Friday and 08.00am to 13.00pm on Saturday, with no
    working on Sunday or Bank Holidays, in order to comply with
    locally enforced standards.

Condition : 22 - Your attention is drawn to the fact that there is a separate
    legal agreement with the Council which relates to the
    development for which this permission is granted.

Condition : 23 - Your proposals may be subject to control under the Building
    Act 1984, the Building Regulations and the London Building
    Acts: 1930-82, and you are advised to consult the Council's
    Streets Management Building Control Service, located at
    Camden Town Hall Argyle Street, WC1H 8EQ. (Tel: 020 7974
    6941)
